# WorldSynth

> Professional multi-engine synthesizer with 11 synthesis engines, Zig DSP backend, Svelte 5 UI, and CLAP plugin support. Linux-first, proprietary.

## Overview

WorldSynth is a polyphonic synthesizer combining 11 synthesis engines (including Neural RAVE/DDSP and Genetic Sound Design) with 64 voices, 16 unison, 6 ZDF filter types, a 256-slot modulation matrix, and GPU-accelerated effects. It runs as a CLAP plugin or standalone application on Linux.

## Core Documentation

- [README](README.md): Project overview, features, system requirements, download info
- [CHANGELOG](CHANGELOG.md): Version history and release notes
- [LICENSE](LICENSE): Proprietary End User License Agreement
- [SECURITY](SECURITY.md): Vulnerability reporting and security policy
- [CONTRIBUTING](CONTRIBUTING.md): How to report bugs, request features, and contribute
- [CODE_OF_CONDUCT](CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md): Community guidelines (Contributor Covenant v2.1)

## Architecture Summary

- **DSP**: Zig 0.14.x, f32 pipeline with f64 ZDF filter integrators, @Vector SIMD, comptime LUTs, 128-sample blocks
- **UI**: Svelte 5 (Runes) + Vite + TypeScript strict, WebKitGTK WebView, dark theme with neon accents
- **Plugin**: CLAP 1.2.7 with hand-written bindings (no @cImport), per-note modulation, thread-pool extension
- **Audio I/O**: JACK (PipeWire), ALSA direct, multi-output (stereo + 8 aux)
- **Threading**: Lock-free work-stealing thread pool, dual-mode scheduling (standalone SCHED_FIFO / plugin CLAP thread-pool)
- **IPC**: WebKitGTK UserMessage API, CQRS + MVCC, FlatBuffers, triple-buffered scope rendering
- **GPU**: CUDA for neural inference (RAVE/DDSP), convolution reverb, spectral processing

## Synthesis Engines

1. Subtractive (ADAA + BLEP anti-aliasing)
2. FM/PM (free 3x3 operator matrix)
3. Wavetable (mip-mapped, Hermite interpolation, optimal transport morphing)
4. Granular (real-time cloud visualizer, live capture)
5. Spectral (FFT freeze/blur/shift/gate/morph with resynthesis)
6. Physical Modeling (Karplus-Strong, bow, blow, strike)
7. Phase Distortion (CZ-style)
8. Formant (vowel synthesis with morphable vocal targets)
9. Sample (single-cycle, multi-sample, loop)
10. Neural (RAVE + DDSP hybrid, GPU inference via CUDA/TensorRT)
11. Genetic Breed (evolutionary crossover/mutation sound design)

## Filter Types

- SVF (Cytomic ZDF, f64, 6-48dB cascaded)
- Moog Ladder (ZDF, f64, Huovilainen)
- Comb (delay-based)
- Formant (ZDF-SVF parallel bandpass)
- Phaser (ZDF allpass)
- Diode Ladder (ZDF, f64, TB-303 style)

## Key Capabilities

- 64 voices, 16 unison per note, per-voice panning and analog drift
- 256-slot modulation matrix (preallocated arena, no RT allocation)
- 32 audio-rate LFOs, 16 MSEGs, chaos modulators (Lorenz/Roessler)
- 8 macros, XY pad, mod recorder, envelope/pitch follower
- FDN reverb, GPU convolution, vocoder, stereo widener
- Arpeggiator with ratchet/probability, clip sequencer with parameter locks
- 8 scenes with morphing, N-preset morph space (Wasserstein optimal transport)
- Quality governor (Live/Studio/Render modes)
- Full accessibility (ARIA, keyboard navigation, high-contrast, colorblind modes)
- Timbral preset browser with semantic search via CLAP-audio embeddings
